remarks: Rotating the points defining a line.  Part of Theorem 4.11 of [Schwabhauser] p. 34.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Apr-2019.)
statement:
btwnlng1.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
btwnlng1.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
btwnlng1.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
btwnlng1.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
btwnlng1.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. P ) $.
btwnlng1.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. P ) $.
btwnlng1.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. P ) $.
btwnlng1.d $e |- ( ph -> X =/= Y ) $.
lnrot1.1 $e |- ( ph -> Y e. ( Z L X ) ) $.
lnrot1.2 $e |- ( ph -> Z =/= X ) $.
lnrot1 $p |- ( ph -> Z e. ( X L Y ) ) $.
